question: What is the elevation of the Spruce Run stream at its source?

content.source_2: reaches. Shortly afterwards, it reaches its confluence with Little Fishing Creek near the community of Eyers Grove. Spruce Run joins Little Fishing Creek upstream of its mouth. The elevation of Spruce Run near its mouth is above sea level. The elevation of the stream at its source is approximately above sea level. The stream is described as a "small stream" in John Gosse Freeze's book "A History of Columbia County, Pennsylvania: From the Earliest Times". The watershed of Spruce Run has an area of . The upper reaches of the stream are in the Pennsylvania State Game Lands Number 226.
